page.title: 08Appuldurcombe House-Wroxall.
page.content: { Appuldurcombe House}is on the Downs west of Wroxall( you can reach it down Appuldurcombe Lane,leaving your car in the car park). The House is a ruin without a roof.It has cellars and a second storey but you can't get into these.You can get into the billiards room,the bathroom, bedrooms,and libary but there is no furniture.You can walk around the garden designed by{Capability Brown the fishpond and the ha-ha(a moat without water).In the museum are photographs of the{Worsley}family and a model of the original building. There was a cell of the Abbey of Montebourg there in the 13th century. This house was knocked down in 1700 by Sir Robert Worsley and rebuilt in 1710.{Appuldurcombe House}(meaning "the apples that grow in the valley") was damaged by a landmine in 1943.
